name: Silver Carpet
climate: Silver Carpet thrives in temperate climates with mild, wet winters and dry summers.
It is well-suited to coastal climates where humidity levels are moderate to high.
This plant can tolerate a Mediterranean climate, typically warm with wet winters.
Avoid areas with harsh, freezing winters as the plant prefers milder conditions.
sunlight: Silver Carpet prefers full sun to partial shade for optimal growth and health.
In areas with very intense sunlight, some afternoon shade can prevent scorching.
Exposing the plant to direct sunlight for at least six hours a day is beneficial.
If growing indoors, place near a sunny window with plenty of natural light exposure.
watering: This plant prefers well-drained soil, water sparingly to prevent root rot issues.
Silver Carpet is drought-tolerant; allow the topsoil to dry slightly before watering.
Avoid overwatering; excessive moisture can lead to fungal diseases in the plant.
In hotter climates, increase watering frequency to maintain adequate soil moisture.
soil: Silver Carpet thrives in sandy or rocky soil that provides excellent drainage.
Avoid heavy clay soils as they can retain too much moisture and harm the plant.
Amend garden soil with gravel or sand to improve drainage and soil structure.
A slightly acidic to neutral pH range is ideal for the healthy growth of the plant.
